thread.title: Riverside plane crash: Cheerleader's miracle survival with MINOR INJURIES after aircraft plunges into homes killing at least four
thread.title_full: Riverside plane crash: Cheerleader's miracle survival with MINOR INJURIES after aircraft plunges into homes killing at least four

author: Steve Robson
title: Riverside plane crash: Cheerleader's miracle survival with MINOR INJURIES after aircraft plunges into homes killing at least four
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A teenage girl has miraculously survived when a small plane plunged into homes killing at least four people in California. 
The aircraft had two adults and three teenagers on board when taking off from Riverside Municipal Airport, east of Los Angeles. 
Dramatic images showed how the plane had left two suburban houses engulfed in flames and largely destroyed. 
Witnesses said it had been raining when the Cessna 310 came down at around 4.40pm local time. 
Nearby homes were evacuated as fire fighters rushed to the scene of devastation. At least one dead after plane crashes into homes in Riverside, California (Photo: Twitter/babyzucchini) A girl was thrown from the plane and survived with only minor injuries (Photo: Twitter/babyzucchini) 
One of the teenage girls has been rescued with only minor injuries. 
It is believed the plane split in half on impact and she was thrown to safety. 
The group were returning to San Jose following a cheerleading conference in Anaheim, according to reports. At least four people are dead and a further five missing (Photo: Twitter/babyzucchini) The cause of the crash is not clear (Photo: Twitter/babyzucchini) 
One of the dead is believed to have been a resident of the damaged homes. 
It is not known if the other three were on the plane or residents. 
But firefighters say at least a further five people are unaccounted for. 
The cause of the crash is not clear but an investigation has been launched. Like us on Facebook
